title: How to Make Breaded Steak with Cooked Rice and Beans

steps.headline: Separate two eggs in a bowl.
Lightly beat the eggs.
Pour the breadcrumbs into a bowl.
Marinade the steak and let it sit for ten minutes.
Dip the steak into the eggs.
steps.description: Be sure to cover the steak completely.

steps.headline: Coat the steak in breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Be sure to cover the steak completely.

steps.headline: Heat the stove to medium high.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet.
Cook the steak on medium high for 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
Add water to the saucepan.
steps.description: A good rule of thumb is 2 cups of water for every 1 cup of rice.

steps.headline: Add the rice to the saucepan.
Bring the water to a rapid boil.
Turn the heat on low.
Cover the saucepan.
Cook the rice for 10 minutes.
Rinse the beans.
Separate the beans.
steps.description: Remove any debris or bad beans.

steps.headline: Cover the beans with water.
Bring the water to a boil.
Boil the beans for 1.5 to 2 hours.
Drain 2 cups of water from the beans.
Add the garlic, salt, pepper, cayenne, onion, and green pepper.
Cover the pot.
steps.description: Cook the beans for 20 more minutes.

steps.headline: Combine and serve food.

text: Make the Breaded Steak Separate two eggs in a bowl.  Lightly beat the eggs.  Pour the breadcrumbs into a bowl.  Marinade the steak and let it sit for ten minutes. This step is optional. Dip the steak into the eggs. Be sure to cover the steak completely. Coat the steak in breadcrumbs. Be sure to cover the steak completely. Heat the stove to medium high.  Heat the olive oil in a skillet.  Cook the steak on medium high for 2 to 3 minutes on each side.  Make the Rice Add water to the saucepan. A good rule of thumb is 2 cups of water for every 1 cup of rice. Add the rice to the saucepan.  Bring the water to a rapid boil.  Turn the heat on low.  Cover the saucepan.  Cook the rice for 10 minutes.  Make the beans Rinse the beans.  Separate the beans. Remove any debris or bad beans. Cover the beans with water.  Bring the water to a boil.  Boil the beans for 1.5 to 2 hours.  Drain 2 cups of water from the beans.  Add the garlic, salt, pepper, cayenne, onion, and green pepper.  Cover the pot. Cook the beans for 20 more minutes. Combine and serve food.
